description: The UK government recently supplied Ukraine with dozens more Storm Shadow cruise missiles, according to people familiar with the matter, a first under Prime Minister Keir Starmer, who has pledged continued support for the country’s war against Russia.
title: UK Sends Kyiv More Storm Shadows as Starmer Pledges Support

description: Israel and Hezbollah inched closer to signing a cease-fire deal that may be concluded in the coming days, according to officials and people familiar with the matter, even as the two sides continued to fire artillery and rockets at each other.
title: Israel and Hezbollah on the Cusp of Deal as Attacks Continue

description: Former Western Asset Management Co. co-Chief Investment Officer Ken Leech was charged by US authorities with engaging in an alleged “cherry-picking” scheme to unfairly allocate better-performing trades to favored portfolios and worse-performing trades to others.
title: Ken Leech Charged by Prosecutors Over Scheme to Allocate Trades

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior editor Joe Sobczyk looks at the reaction to Donald Trump’s Treasury pick. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump’s Pick of Bessent for Treasury Soothes Wall Street

description: The European Union is proposing to sanction several Chinese firms that it claims helped Russian companies develop attack drones that were deployed against Ukraine.
title: EU Proposes to Sanction Chinese Firms Aiding Russian War Effort

description: The White House asked Congress to provide about $5.7 billion in additional funds to cover cost overruns for three Virginia-class submarines, as well as for shipyard enhancements and higher wages to attract welders, pipefitters and engineers.
title: White House Asks Congress for Extra $5.7 Billion for Submarine Cost Overruns

description: South Koreans’ outlook for the economy deteriorated at the fastest pace in more than two years in November, according to a monthly central bank survey conducted after Donald Trump’s US election victory.
title: South Koreans’ Economic Outlook Frays at Fastest Pace Since 2022

description: Republican lawmakers are calling on President Joe Biden’s administration to preserve documents related to the proposed sale of United States Steel Corp. to Japan-based Nippon Steel Corp., expressing “serious concerns” that politics have tainted an ongoing national security review of the deal and raising the prospect of a congressional probe.
title: US Steel Review Targeted by Republicans for Potential Probe

description: President-elect Trump is expected to appoint Kash Patel to a high-profile position at either the FBI or the Justice Department, Axios reports, citing people familiar with the transition.
title: Trump Likely to Tap Kash Patel for FBI or DOJ Post, Axios Says

description: Protesters demanding the release of Pakistan’s jailed former premier Imran Khan reached the edge of the nation’s capital, authorities said late Monday night, overcoming efforts by Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif’s government to stifle the nationwide protests.
title: Imran Khan’s Supporters March to Islamabad Demanding His Release

description: Wage gains in Canada are trailing behind rising food prices, a major force driving the labor strife that has upended the country’s supply chains.
title: Food Inflation in Canada Outpaces Wages, Fuels Worker Angst

description: Venezuelans are bracing for severe cooking-gas shortages after a blast knocked out a plant serving almost half the country.
title: Venezuela Braces for Gas Shortages as Regime Blames ‘Terrorists’

description: The US Justice Department has moved to end its pursuit of criminal charges against Donald Trump, signaling a conclusion to the extraordinary federal prosecution of a former president whose reelection ensured he’d be shielded from charges in the White House.
title: Justice Department Moves to Drop Trump Prosecutions in Washington and Florida

description: Mozambique’s Constitutional Council said its judges have received death threats as they work to validate the outcome of last month’s disputed elections, which have sparked protests in which dozens of people have died.
title: Top Mozambique Court Gets Death Threats as It Weighs Vote Result

description: A Republican sweep in November’s US election threatens a niche tax break that helps American colleges to upgrade dorms and academic buildings on their campuses for cheap.
title: Colleges’ Bond Tax Break at Risk From GOP Goal to Punish Schools

description: Donald Trump is the richest person to become US president, and his far-flung business empire has only expanded since he last held the post. Then as now, he is wont to name other rich people to positions of power. He’s nominated several super-affluent individuals to lead government departments — hedge fund manager Scott Bessent for Treasury, Cantor Fitzgerald LP chief executive officer Howard Lutnick for Commerce, North Dakota Governor Doug Burgum for Interior, World Wrestling Entertainment co-fo
title: How Conflict of Interest Rules Impact Trump, Musk and Other Rich Nominees

description: The UK government is in danger of losing the trust of corporate leaders if it fails to mitigate the impact of last month’s budget, the chair of the country’s most powerful business lobby said.
title: UK Risks Losing Trust of Business After Budget, CBI Chair Says

description: When Brandon Johnson was elected mayor of Chicago, the progressive politician was received with nervous caution from the city’s business leaders who’d lost patience with his predecessor.
title: Fight Over Schools and Taxes Pits Chicago Elite Against Mayor

description: Nobody in Romania saw the presidential election upset coming — not the public, not the pundits — and not the first-round winner, an ultranationalist with a formidable TikTok following who has doled out praise for Vladimir Putin.
title: TikTok and Praise for Putin Spur Romania’s Nationalist Insurgent

description: Swedish and Finnish authorities identified a Chinese ship anchored northeast of Denmark as potentially linked to incidents of damage to data cables in the Baltic Sea, saying it was “of interest” to their criminal probes.
title: Nordic Authorities Link Chinese Ship to Probes of Damaged Cables

description: South Africa should set up a single agency to fight graft, according to the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development, which led a review of the nation’s procurement practices.
title: South Africa Needs a Single Body to Fight Corruption, OECD Says

description: The US Supreme Court sought the federal government’s views in a billion-dollar copyright clash between the music industry and internet provider Cox Communications Inc.
title: High Court Seeks US Views in $1 Billion Music Copyright Case

description: The US Supreme Court rejected a tobacco industry appeal and refused to block a new federal rule that will require cigarette packages to carry graphic new warnings about the health dangers of smoking.
title: Tobacco Companies Rejected by Supreme Court on Warning Labels

description: Israel’s central bank left interest rates unchanged as it weighs a war-related economic slowdown and quickening inflation.
title: Israel Holds Rates as War Quickens Inflation and Slows Economy

description: Russia’s war on Ukraine has been dictated as much by events in the air as by territorial gains on the front line.
title: What Missiles Are Russia and Ukraine Firing? What Do They Do?

description: The Republic of Congo will begin implementing reforms next year aimed at boosting revenue collection to help end a cash shortage that resulted in the government restructuring its domestic debt, Finance Minister Jean-Baptiste Ondaye said.
title: Congo Republic Plans Reforms to Boost Revenue Amid Cash Shortage

description: The European Union has only seen limited progress in recent weeks in negotiations with China over a comprehensive deal to replace tariffs on electric vehicles, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: EU Sees Little Progress on Deal With China to Avoid EV Tariffs

description: Tensions between the two most powerful political clans in the Philippines are at boiling point, with Vice President Sara Duterte telling President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. she would have him assassinated if someone did the same to her. The political marriage that brought the rival Marcos and Duterte dynasties to the highest government posts has been unraveling fast, threatening to reshape the political landscape ahead of midterm elections next year. What’s not clear is whether the war of words refle
title: What Is the Assassination Threat Shaking Philippines Politics?

description: Germany’s Social Democrats backed Chancellor Olaf Scholz as their lead candidate for February’s snap election, as they look to erase a big deficit in the polls.
title: Scholz Gets Backing of SPD Leadership for Reelection Bid

description: Chile’s traditional right-wing parties saw their support rebound in regional elections Sunday, while centrists won key areas including the capital Santiago, indicating a shift away from political extremes.
title: Chile Moderates See Key Vote Wins as Political Extremes Lose Out

description: The United Arab Emirates said three people arrested for the murder of an Israeli-Moldovan rabbi in the Gulf country are from Uzbekistan.
title: UAE Says Alleged Murderers of Israeli Rabbi Were From Uzbekistan

description: Australia’s budget deficit is likely to swell beyond forecasts, in a reversal of previous years when massive revenue upgrades ended up returning the books to the black, according to Deloitte Access Economics.
title: Australia Budget Blow Out Seen as Structural Deficit Takes Hold

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Iran Awaits Trump Redux in Changed Middle East

description: Keir Starmer faces further fallout from his government’s first budget, with the prime minister’s latest initiative to reduce welfare spending running up against UK business warnings about job cuts due to higher taxes.
title: Starmer’s Budget Pains Grow as Welfare Push Hit by Jobs Warning

description: UniCredit SpA’s surprise bid for Banco BPM SpA has left Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni’s government struggling to work out if its plans to create Italy’s third major banking group are now defunct.
title: UniCredit’s BPM Curveball Leaves Meloni Scrambling on Banking Plan

description: France’s far-right leader Marine Le Pen renewed her threat to bring down the government in a no-confidence motion over next year’s budget, compounding uncertainties that are pushing up measures of risk on bond markets to fresh highs.
title: Le Pen Increases Pressure on French Government Amid Budget Talks

description: Israel’s central bank is set to hold interest rates for a seventh consecutive time, as it weighs how wars in Gaza and Lebanon are quickening inflation and slowing the economy.
title: Israel to Hold Rates as it Weighs War Inflation, Slowing Economy

description: Georgia’s ruling party convened parliament for its first session since last month’s election even as opposition lawmakers enforced a boycott and protesters continued street demonstrations over the results.
title: Georgia Ruling Party Opens Parliament Defying Opposition Boycott

description: Group of Seven allies are set to step up pressure on China while offering Kyiv “unwavering commitment” amid accusations that Beijing has increased support for Russia in its war against Ukraine.
title: G-7 Poised to Boost Pressure on China Over Russian Support

description: Just days before Ireland’s general election, Prime Minister Simon Harris has seen his support erode with his Fine Gael party slipping slightly behind both its coalition partner and the main opposition party, according to a poll released Monday.
title: Irish Prime Minister Drops in Polls Days Ahead of Election

description: European Central Bank Governing Council member Mario Centeno said any US push to set aside enhanced bank capital rules will go wrong, and Europe shouldn’t risk taking that path.
title: ECB’s Centeno Says Plans to Ditch Basel Rules Are Likely to Misfire

description: A little-known pro-Russian candidate was set to win the first round of Romania’s presidential election after an unprecedented backlash against establishment candidates left Prime Minister Marcel Ciolacu facing elimination.
title: Pro-Putin Candidate Surges in Romania Vote as Premier Edged Out

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi appealed for peaceful parliamentary proceedings shortly before opposition lawmakers demanded a debate about billionaire Gautam Adani, forcing proceedings to be adjourned.
title: Modi Warns Opposition as He Faces Adani Questions in Parliament

description: Australia’s government is likely to secure parliamentary passage of the central planks of its housing policy after the minority Greens party reversed course and agreed to support the legislation following a series of electoral setbacks.
title: Australia PM’s Housing Plan Set to Pass After Greens About-Face

description: President-elect Donald Trump’s pick of Scott Bessent as Treasury secretary may give Beijing room to negotiate with the US over their trade tensions, in part due to his moderate stance on tariffs.
title: Bessent at Treasury May Give China Breathing Room Over Tariffs

description: A DHL cargo plane flying from Germany to Lithuania crashed close to Vilnius Airport, killing a crew member and injuring two pilots, according to police.
title: DHL Cargo Plane Crashes Near Vilnius Airport in Lithuania

description: Israel is potentially days away from a cease-fire deal with Lebanon’s Hezbollah, the Israeli ambassador to the United States said, following a new round of shuttle diplomacy by a senior envoy for the outgoing Biden administration.
title: Israel-Hezbollah Close to Ceasefire Deal, Says Israel’s Envoy to Washington

description: Scott Bessent, who is Donald Trump’s pick for Treasury secretary, told the Wall Street Journal that he’ll focus on following through on the president-elect’s tax cut and tariff pledges once he takes office.
title: Trump’s Treasury Choice Bessent Tells WSJ Tax Cuts a Priority

description: After years of self-discipline, calls are growing for Germany to loosen the purse strings.
title: Bond Market Has €400 Billion Check Ready for Germany to Spend

description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. on Monday vowed to uphold the rule of law after Vice President Sara Duterte spoke about having the leader assassinated if she gets killed.
title: Marcos Vows to Uphold Law After VP Duterte’s Murder Threat

description: Apple Inc. Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook is visiting China for at least the third time this year, showing up at a suppliers’ conference on the same day a top Beijing official convened an important meeting with a group of foreign CEOs.
title: Apple Chief Returns to China as Beijing Prepares to Fete CEOs

description: Uruguay elected Yamandu Orsi of the left-wing opposition party to become the nation’s next president in a runoff vote Sunday, joining an anti-incumbent trend in the Americas as voters’ worries about inequality and crime spurred change.
title: Orsi Wins Uruguay Election as Voters Oust Incumbent Party

description: As the last negotiations for a global plastic treaty begin in South Korea, countries are divided over whether to cap production of the ubiquitous material.
title: Can the World Unite to End the Plastic Pollution Crisis?
